Package Main.Others

Class LevelGeneration

java.lang.Object
Main.Others.LevelGeneration
public class LevelGeneration
extends java.lang.Object
Public class LevelGeneration is responsible for generating the brick for all 5 levels of the game. It receives the player choices in the custom menu and generates the bricks accordingly.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelGeneration

      public LevelGeneration​(int[][] choice, java.awt.Dimension area, int levelCount)
      This method sends the custom choices, game screen area and level count to this class.
      Parameters:
      choice - The choices of the player in the custom menu.
      area - The area of the game screen to calculate brick score.
      levelCount - The level count of the game.

  • Method Details

    • makeAllLevel

      private Brick[] makeAllLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickRow, int level)
      This method controls the generation for all the custom levels and returns an array of Bricks for a custom level.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - This is the area of the game screen. It is used to get the width of the screen so that brick length can be determined by dividing the number of bricks.
      brickRow - This is the number of bricks in a row entered by the player. It is used unless the player chooses a level type which uses random number of bricks in a row.
      level - This is the level number and is used to check the level custom choices.
      Returns:
      The method returns an array of Bricks which is used for the generation of a custom level.

    • makeSingleTypeLevel

      private Brick[] makeSingleTypeLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea)
      This method is used to generate an array of 31 bricks in 3 lines, all of which are the same type. This method is used to generate an array of Clay Bricks for the first default level. By studying the code closely, we can conclude that this method works exactly the same as the method for making the other 3 default chessboard levels if we specify both typeA and typeB brick to be the same. So, the method body is replaced with the method call for the makeChessboardLevel to improve readability.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - This is the area of the game screen. It is used to get the width of the screen so that brick length can be determined by dividing the number of bricks.
      Returns:
      This method returns an array of Clay Bricks for the first default level.

    • makeChessboardLevel

      private Brick[] makeChessboardLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int typeA, int typeB, int level)
      This method is used to generate an array of 31 bricks in 3 lines. The bricks are of 2 different types depending on the conditions specified. This method controls the generation of the other 3 default levels. For even rows, even bricks are of typeA while odd bricks are of typeB. For odd rows, bricks 6, 7 and 11 are of typeA while the rest are typeB. The brick generation code has been rewritten to improve readability.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - This is the area of the game screen. It is used to get the width of the screen so that brick length can be determined by dividing the number of bricks.
      typeA - This is the first type of brick to be generated for bricks satisfying certain conditions.
      typeB - This is the second type of brick to be generated for bricks satisfying certain conditions.
      level - This is the level number and is used to check the level orientation.
      Returns:
      This method returns an array of Bricks for the other 3 default levels.

    • getBrickLocation

      private java.awt.Point getBrickLocation​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int i, int brickOnLine, int brickLength, int brickHeight, int level)
      This method is used to calculate the brick positions for brick generation. The level orientation must be checked to make sure that the bricks are spawned in the right places.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - This is the area of the game screen. It is used to get the width of the screen so that brick length can be determined by dividing the number of bricks.
      i - This is the number of the current brick being generated.
      brickOnLine - This is the number of bricks on an even line.
      brickLength - This is the length of a brick.
      brickHeight - This is the height of a brick.
      level - This is the level number and is used to check the level orientation.
      Returns:
      This method returns the new brick position for brick generation.

    • makeCustomLevels

      public Brick[][] makeCustomLevels​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea)
      This method is used to create 5 levels to be loaded into the game. At first, the 5 default levels are created and loaded into the double array of Bricks. Then, the level type entered by the player is read. If the level type for that level entered is not default, a custom level is generated and overwrites the array of Bricks for that level.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - This is the area of the game screen. It is used to get the width of the screen so that brick length can be determined by dividing the number of bricks.
      Returns:
      The method returns a double array of Bricks which contain the bricks generated for all 4 level.

    • makeDefaultLevels

      private Brick[][] makeDefaultLevels​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea)
      This method creates the 5 default levels and loads them into a double array of Bricks.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - This is the area of the game screen. It is used to get the width of the screen so that brick length can be determined by dividing the number of bricks.
      Returns:
      The method returns a double array of Bricks which contain the bricks generated for all default 4 level.

    • makeBrick

      private Brick makeBrick​(java.awt.Point point, java.awt.Dimension size, int type)
      This method is used to create a brick of a certain type with a given size at a given point.
      Parameters:
      point - This is the top-left corner of the new brick.
      size - This is the dimensions of the new brick.
      type - This is the type of the new brick.
      Returns:
      This method returns a new brick of a certain type with a given size at a given point.
